page.title: 02SHOPS IN FLITWICK 1.
page.content: { TESCO SUPERMARKET. FLITWICK TESCO WAS BUILT IN 1980. THE SITE WAS ORIGINALLY SET ASIDE FOR A CO-OP, BUT WAS ALLOCATED FOR TESCO INSTEAD. THE RANGE OF GOODS STOCKED INCLUDES, GROCERIES, CLOTHES, DAIRY PRODUCTS, HARDWARE, STATIONERY, MEAT, GARDEN ACCESSORIES, AND BREAD. THE FLOOR AREA OF THE STORE IS 29000 SQUARE YARDS, 37000 INCLUDING STORAGE AREA. THE WEEKLY TAKINGS ARE OVER Â£300,000.(OVER Â£1 MILLION A MONTH). THE NUMBER OF CUSTOMERS A DAY IS ROUGHLY 3500 OR 21000 A WEEK. THE NUMBER OF STAFF EMPLOYED IS 309, BUT 193 OF THEM ARE PART-TIME. THE SPHERE OF INFLUENCE OF THE SHOP RANGES FROM BEDFORD IN THE NORTH TO HITCHIN IN THE SOUTH,CLOPHILL IN THE EAST AND BLETCHLEY IN THE WEST.
